title: Mexico takes down USMNT to win 10th Gold Cup
description: Edson Álvarez's second-half header gave Mexico a 2-1 win over the United States and a 10th Gold Cup title in a frenetic final at Houston's NRG Stadium on Sunday night.
author: ESPN News Services

title: Nats seek 'fresh approach,' fire Martinez, Rizzo
description: Headed into an off day and stuck in last place in the NL East, the Washington Nationals fired manager Davey Martinez and general manager Mike Rizzo on Sunday night, hours after a 6-4 loss at home completed a sweep by the Boston Red Sox.
author: Jesse Rogers

title: Edson Álvarez's tiebreaking goal gives Mexico 2-1 win over US for 10th Gold Cup title
description: Edson Álvarez scored a tiebreaking goal in the 77th minute after a video review reversed an offside call, and Mexico beat the United States 2-1 on Sunday night for its record 10th CONCACAF Gold Cup title. Chris Richards put the U.S. ahead in the fourth minute, heading in a Sebastian Berhalter free kick for the second time in the tournament, but Raúl Jiménez tied the score in the 27th with his third goal of this Gold Cup.

title: Mexico wins its 2nd straight CONCACAF Gold Cup title and 10th overall, beating the United States 2-1
Norris gets to 'live that feeling' of being Silverstone winner
description: Lando Norris did not let a cut nose dampen his celebrations after his first British Grand Prix win.

title: The familiar issues frustrating England and their fans
description: After taking two steps forward last week, England have taken another back in their crushing loss to India. BBC Sport explores the issues holding them back.

title: Beaumont hails 'massive' win as Sciver-Brunt ruled out of T20 series
description: England's 'fight' helped them dig deep to claim a dramatic final-ball victory over India at The Kia Oval, but they will be without captain Nat Sciver-Brunt as they attempt to complete a comeback in the women's T20 series.

title: England fail first test of Euros defence - and have only themselves to blame
description: The camera panned to Sarina Wiegman in the 82nd minute of England's opening night loss to France. She was deep in thought, tearing strips of paper from her tactical notepad.
